name: apparatchik
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a loyal and senior member of a political party, especially the Communist Party in the former USSR: A former apparatchik in the Communist Party, she became a diplomat.
More examplesFewer examplesTo some political leaders, the results have shown the envoys to be nothing more than overrated apparatchiks who have made little difference. Most ex-guerilla fighters are in their forties now and have become party apparatchiks.She criticized him as a White House apparatchik who always backs the president.The convention will be a mix of professional politicians, high-ranking party apparatchiks and ordinary voters.
